content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-326-06-B |Item_parent=Regulatory framework for therapeutic prescribing and recommendations for correct use |Item_parent_short=Regulatory framework for therapeutic prescribing and recommendations for correct use |Rank=B |Title=Knowing the definition of continuing professional development on medicines: assessing the source and reliability of information |Description=Recall the principles of the DCP and its procedures concerning medicines. |Rubric=Definition |Contributors= |Order=6}} According to the Code of Medical Deontology - '''article R4127-11 du CSP''' - : ''every doctor maintains and perfects his knowledge in compliance with his obligation of continuous professional development''. https://www.legifrance.gouv.fr/codes/article_lc/LEGIARTI000025843562 This '''obligation''' of continuing professional development [DPC] concerns '''all doctors registered''' with the Ordre des médecins. The objectives of this CPD are set out in Article L4021-1 of the CSP: "Continuing professional development aims to maintain and update knowledge and skills and to improve practices. It constitutes an obligation for healthcare professionals'''. https://www.legifrance.gouv.fr/codes/section_lc/LEGITEXT000006072665/LEGISCTA000020888297/#LEGISCTA000020897548 ===Methods of CPD=== The individual CPD obligation for doctors is changing regularly. At present - and for the period 2020 to 2022 - CPD can be validated following : * Completion of a "free" course, * completion of a course recommended by the national professional councils, * a commitment to an accreditation process.

question.question: According to the Code of Medical Deontology, what is the primary purpose of continuing professional development (CPD) for doctors?
question.option_a: To maintain and update knowledge and skills, and to improve practices
question.option_b: To stay up-to-date with the latest medical research and treatments
question.option_c: To demonstrate a doctor's commitment to their profession and the healthcare system
question.option_d: To ensure that doctors have the necessary qualifications and licenses to practice medicine
